comments.commentBody: Amy, you are wonderful.
The best part was the very end, "AKR lives..."
BRAVO!!!!
Oh boy. Safe journeys. Off to buy your memoir.

Dearest Amy - Your extraordinary, heartrending words have more of an impact than you could ever know. I'm reading this article on the 5th anniversary of my husband's unexpected death, and find it a great comfort.  What are the odds that I would find something so beautiful on such a dark day? You want to give your husband the strength to continue. By publishing this, you have managed to lend me a bit of that strength, as well. Thank you so very, very much. I promise you that the love you and your husband share will endure, no matter what.  I wish you both the best.

Dear Amy: I was diagnosed with the same in June, 2015, and I am still here! Take care of yourself, avoid the "tyranny of numbers" regardjng the stats related to ovarian cancer, and enjoy every day that you are lucky enough to have. I never found a "Jason", but a little 3-year old sweetie who calls me "Granny" keeps me motivated to  "keep living until I die". All the best to you...
Dear Karen, Wish you All the Very Best. May you see your little sweetie becoming a College student and also then see her walking down the isle with the love of her life.
thanks a lot...my wife wants his number!  ;)

There's a sizable puddle 'neath my eyes on my desktop after reading this. Not sure if it's because of the sadness I feel for this couple, the touching sentiment the article engenders, or both. I do know that my wife's attempt at such a profile for me would start with "Seriously? THIS is who you wanna date? Whatever..."
Nice one Jase.

Dear Amy, Your words are art and so is the life you created with Jason. Thank you for your words and for the white space...which feels like a metaphor for hope and peace and love, a message to the whole world, who has fallen in love with you.
Amy...bless your journey. Please take pause to know you made this world a better place. In light of the world around us...you gave me hope in humanity once again.  Thank you...safe passage.

You're right. I might.
Love, Laura
Beautifully stated jazz one.  Thank YOU for such kind and powerful words.

Moving article. I am one of those who say Jason is very lucky for being loved by such a witty and generous woman. And about the plans she has for him, it reminded me of the lyrics by Chico Buarque:

"Amores serão sempre amáveis
Futuros amantes, quiçá
Se amarão sem saber
Com o amor que eu um dia
Deixei pra você"

(And I am sorry if one does not understand Portuguese)
Ughhh ... [explicative] cancer. You are incredible, love. And Jason as well.
John—I love that you wrote this—and I second Amy's nomination with all mu support, and love.

Tears rolling down my face. Thank you for writing this. May we all be reminded to stop and "Be" and to cherish our partners as much as we did the day we fell in love. All the best to you and your family.

Amy,

I was so touched by this.....I am thinking, though, that Jason would write an equally endearing essay about you if the shoe was on the other foot. You both have been very lucky to have such an amazing life together. My thoughts are with you both....

My 23 yr old son sent this to me. His father, my husband Corbin is much alike your wonderful husband. Thank you for sharing this moving essay. I, too, like other commenters, wanted to know more about you. But I think you are equally wonderful in this relationship. I can just feel
it in your writing. I am sorry for your illness, sorry you won't have each other for another 50 years. For more.

Amy
Your story is a reminder to me that there is hopeful unconditional love in the world. The mere fact that you want your husband to be happy and loved even without you shows how beautiful a person you truly are!
I wish you many happy and healthy days with your family...always and forever!

Dear Amy,

You just made your husband the most popular soon-to-be widower ever.

Your selfless words are both hopeful and heavy with grief. This is not fair. This is not right. This is too soon to leave this life and this world and this family and this Love. This is too soon...

But, you put your message out there into the Universe, also known as the New York Times. May the Universe respond in kind with peace, peace of mind, Love, and hopefully some more time.

Agreed Desert girl...one other thing I forgot to mention is that it is much more likely to have physical and sexual abuse of students in private rather than public schools.

In the massive US public school system, sexual or physical abuse of the student happens but it is rather uncommon related to the massive numbers of students taught.

In private schools, especially Catholic schools this abuse was, is an epidemic.

This report is another example of the bias and fake news in the NYT and the hypocrisy of the Democrats.

Does anyone think for one second that:

There were no contacts by the Democrats in Congress, the White House or Hillary's campaign with any foreign leader or his surrogates during last years campaign? That there was no discussion of the US election, who they expected to win or what they intended to do after the election?

That Obama's open mike conversation with the President of Russia on waiting until after the 2012 election to pursue nuclear discussions was an isolated incident?

That the comments of numerous European leaders or their staff about Trump or their open public endorsement of Hillary during the 2016 campaign occurred with no communication with Hillary's campaign staff or Obama's staff?

That the FBI monitored Trump and his staff's phone calls but not Hillary or her staff's phone calls without a directive from Obama?

That, if the FBI's monitoring was justified and security related, there were no Democrat's conversations with all world leaders monitored?

That the one sided leaks are not politically motivated?

That we are any closer to finding out who actually leaked Hillary's emails to WikiLeaks?

Where is a responsible journalist when you need one? An unbiased media would get the answers to all of these questions? Otherwise the witch hunt and fake news charges stand.

If you strip away all these allegations and disregard all of the Obama leaks, what are you left with? The truth, which is that President Obama allowed the Russians to hack an election (his claim) and did nothing about it, and a DNC that was in cahoots with one of the candidates.

Democrats are obviously working very hard to obstruct this from remaining the one true story of the election.

Actually, Gene, it shows the gross hypocrisy of Republicans, considering the amount of taxpayer funds that party has spent on relentless investigations into far less serious matters, like a ten-year-old already-litigated land deal, including firing the initial special prosecutor when his conclusions weren't what they wanted, so they got Kenneth Starr in there; seven years harassing a sitting president in the hopes of finding something, anything, on which to hang him, settling for a fib about a consensual affair and impeaching him over it; a committee created for the sole purpose of bringing the president and SOS down over a terrorist attack (and I remind you that Democrats got behind Pres. Bush after 9/11`. Republicans saw Benghazi as a political opportunity); a private email server, never hacked.
But a US enemy illegally hacking one party's emails in order to interfere with out election and help throw it to its preferred candidate, an Attorney General lying while under oath to Congress regarding this serious matter, among others, causes yawns amongst Republicans. It is weird and creepy that, apparently had Sessions fibbed about a consensual sex act in an actual witch hunt with no national security or risks to our democracy, that THAT would have gotten you Republicans demanding impeachment and removal. Way. Off. Base. And dishonest.

Hillary. Really? (As if we still really need to get the bottom of this Benghazi thing.). Hillary is gone, very gone. Only Trump is here and now, in power, spewing executive orders like a king, with a plate in front of his nose full of Russian borscht and bliny, and with far more serious subterfuge. Whether you liked the outcome or not, we are now all of us the victims of foreign government-sponsored spies and criminal computer hacking on a scale never before seen, with possible continuing blackmail by Russia. Hillary Clinton now has nothing to do with anything except getting clobbered in a rigged election. This is not going away.
I wonder how many lies would be discovered if we saw Mr. Trump's Tax returns?

A distant relative was diagnosed with Stage 4 ovarian cancer in 2012. Had metastasized to her lungs, diaphragm, then to her brain, where she had 29 lesions. Her doctors assessed her condition and told her to go home and make the best of her remaining month(s). She instead went to MD Anderson and is still alive 5 years later.  Hopefully this is not inappropriate, and she probably (hopefully) has top doctors.  Granted there are many types of ovarian cancer.
Stop, stop, stop!!! Everyone's journey is different.

To Mary ANC : You are one crazy person. You are so adament that Ms Rosenthal MUST go now. Why, are you sharpening your claws and waiting to pounce upon Jason the minute you get a chance? Tough luck, 'cos everyone here except you are praying for more for Amy. And they are going to have more time here on earth together. No thanks to you.
No words . . .
